recipe_long_name: Amboli, Maharashtrian Amboli recipe - How to make Amboli, Maharashtrian Amboli
ingredients:
For Amboli:
 2 cups rice (chawal)
 1 cup urad dal (split black lentils)
 1 tsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 10 tsp oil for greasing and cooking
recipe:
For amboli
To make 
amboli
, clean and wash the rice. Drain, add 3 cups of water and soak the in a deep bowl overnight.
Clean and wash urad dal. Drain, add 2 cups of water and fenugreek seeds and soak the in a deep bowl overnight.
Next day, drain the rice and wash it once again.
Combine the rice, salt and ½ cup of water and blend in a mixer to a smooth paste.
Transfer the rice mixture into a bowl.
Also drain the urad dal, wash it once again and blend in a mixer without using water.
Add this urad dal mixture to the bowl containing rice mixture and mix well.
Add ½ cup water and salt and mix well.
Heat a non-stick pan and grease it with ½ tsp of oil.
Pour a ladleful of the batter on it and spread in a circular manner to make 125 mm. (5”) diameter round.
Cover with a lid and cook for 1 minute.
Open the lid and spread ½ tsp of oil along the edges.
Flip over, again cover and cook on the other side for 30 seconds.
Repeat steps 9 to 13 to make 9 more amboli.
Serve the 
 hot.
tags:
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Maharashtrian Breakfast
Breakfast  Chillas, Indian Pancakes
Indian Party Starters
times: Preparation Time: 2 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 17 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mixed Sprouts Usal recipe - How to make Mixed Sprouts Usal
ingredients:
For Mixed Sprouts Usal:
 1 cup boiled mixed sprouts
 2 tbsp oil
 1 cup chopped onions
 3 garlic (lehsun) cloves , roughly chopped
 1/2 cup freshly grated coconut
 salt to taste
 1 tsp lemon juice
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania) for garnish
 For The Masala Paste:
 3/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tbsp malvani masala or 2 green chillies , roughly chopped
 25 mm piece of ginger (adrak) , roughly chopped
 salt to taste
recipe:
For the masala paste
Combine the coriander, malvani masala, ginger and salt along with 2 tbsp of water and blend in a mixer till to a smooth paste. Keep aside.
For mixed sprouts usal
To make 
mixed sprouts usal
, heat 1½ tbsp of oil in a pan, add the onions and garlic and sauté till the onions turn translucent.
Add the coconut and sauté till it turns golden brown.
Heat the remaining ½ tbsp of oil in the same pan, add the mixed sprouts and sauté for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the prepared masala paste, salt and ½ cup of water, mix well and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the lemon juice and mix well.
Serve the to make 
 hot garnished with coriander.
tags:
Maharashtrian Bhaji
Mother's Day

Indian Party

Indian Pulses
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 12 mins, Total Time: 22 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Dhapate, Authentic Maharashtrian Thalipeeth recipe - How to make Dhapate, Authentic Maharashtrian Thalipeeth
ingredients:
To Be Blended Into A Smooth Paste:
 1/2 cup roughly chopped tomatoes
 5 garlic (lehsun) cloves
 1 tbsp roughly chopped green chillies
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 Other Ingredients For Dhapate:
 1 cup jowar (white millet) flour
 1/2 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1/2 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/4 cup bajra (black millet) flour
 1/4 cup rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 1/2 cup finely chopped onions
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tbsp sesame seeds (til)
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp coriander (dhania) powder
 salt to taste
 4 1/2 tsp oil for brushing
 18 tsp oil for cooking
 For Serving:
 thecha
 curd
recipe:
For dhapate
To make 
dhapate
, in a deep bowl, add jowar flour, whole wheat flour, besan. Bajra flour, rice flour, onions, coriander, sesame seeds, turmeric powder, coriander powder, prepared paste and salt and knead into a soft dough using approx. 1 cup of water.
Divide the dough into 9 equal portions.
Take a butter paper and place it on a clean, dry surface, put a portion of the dough on it and keep tapping to form a circle of  175 mm. (7”) diameter thin circle using wet hands.
Using your index finger make holes at intervals.
Heat a non-stick tava, grease it with ½ tsp of oil, place the butter paper on it and remove the butter paper gently.
Put 1 tsp oil evenly over it.
Cover with a lid and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes or till it is cooked well.
Flip and use more 1 tsp of oil evenly over it and cook from both the sides till light brown in colour.
Repeat steps 3 to 8 to make more 8 more thalipeeths.
Serve the 
 immediately with thecha and curd.
tags:
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Maharashtrian Breakfast
Breakfast  Chillas, Indian Pancakes
One Dish Vegetarian Meals
Indian Party
Healthy Chilla recipes, Pancakes 
Indian Travel Food Paratha
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 45 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Healthy Green Tomato Chutney recipe - How to make Healthy Green Tomato Chutney
ingredients:
4 medium green tomatoes
 2 green chillies
 2 tbsp roasted powdered peanut
 1 tsp sugar
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp oil
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
recipe:
Method
Wash and cut the green tomatoes, green chillies and coriander leaves.
Take kadhai and heat the oil, add the tomatoes and green chillies cook till they become soft.
Remove from the flame and add the groundnut powder,sugar and grind in the mixer.
Take a bowl put the chutney.
Make a tadka with 1 tsp oil, mustard seeds, hing turmeric powder and mix with the above chutney.
Tastes good with any dish.
tags:
Maharashtrian Chutneys, Maharashtrian Pickles
Quick Chutneys
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rice and Masoor Dal Khichdi recipe - How to make Rice and Masoor Dal Khichdi
ingredients:
1 cup rice (chawal)
 1/2 cup masoor dal (split red lentil)
 1 tbsp oil
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
 4 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 1/2 tbsp chopped green chillies
 3 kokum
 1 tbsp jaggery (gur)
 1 tsp goda masala
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) and cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Wash and drained the rice and masoor dal. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a pressure cooker and add the mustards seeds.
When the the mustard seeds crackle add the asafoetida, curry leaves, turmeric, rice and masoor dal and saute for 2 minutes.
Add 4 cups of water and sauté for a few seconds.
Add all other ingredients and pressure cook on high flame for 3 whistles.
Remove from the flame, allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Serve hot with a pickle of your choice.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
collection of khichdi recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Raw Mango and Onion Paratha recipe - How to make Raw Mango and Onion Paratha
ingredients:
1 cup peeled and chopped raw mango
 1 cup chopped onions
 2 tbsp roasted and crushed peanuts
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 2 pinches fenugreek seeds (methi) powder
 salt to taste
 1 tsp sugar
 a pinch turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 cups whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 water as required
recipe:
Method
Put the mango into the mixer, add chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, sugar and methi powder and blend in a mixer into a coarse paste.
Add the onions and peanut powder and again grind for a minute.
Shift into a serving bowl.
Combine the flour with enough water and knead into a semi-stiff dough. Cover and keep aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
Divide into 6 equal portions.
Roll 1 portion in to a small circle. Put a portion of the above stuffing in the middle,close it by bringing all the edges into the middle and roll again into mini paratha.
Heat a tava and cook the mini paratha on both the sides till light brown in colour using a little oil.
Repeat with the remaining dough and stuffing to make 5 more parathas.
Serve hot.
tags:
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Mixer
Tava
Quick Rotis / Parathas
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Farali Puranpoli recipe - How to make Farali Puranpoli
ingredients:
400 gms boiled and grated potatoes
 250 gms ghee
 400 gms rajgira flour
 sugar to taste
 2 tbsp cashewnuts (kaju)
 4 to 5 cardamoms
 2 tbsp almonds (badam)
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the potatoes and saute on a medium flame for 10 minutes.
Add the sugar, cashewnuts, cardamom and almonds and mix well. Keep aside.
Add 1 tsp oil to the rajgira flour, mix well and knead into a soft and smooth dough, using water as required.
Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and roll into small rotis of 5" diameter.
Place a portion of the stuffing at the centre and roll out again into a circle of 6" diameter.
Heat a tava and cook each roti using little ghee, till golden brown from both the sides.
Serve hot.
tags:
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
Janmashtami
Ganesh Chaturthi
Ekadashi Recipes, Ekadasi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Quick Spring Onions ki Sabji recipe - How to make Quick Spring Onions ki Sabji
ingredients:
3 cups spring onions finely chopped
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 4 green chillies
 2 tsp ginger (adrak)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 finely chopped tomatoes
 salt to taste
 3 tsp oil
 2 tsp water
recipe:
Method
Heat a kadhai, add oil.
Add cumin seeds, let it splutter then add onions of spring onions with green chillies. Let it cook for 2 minutes.
Now add ginger garlic paste, let it cook for 2 minutes.
Now add tomatoes, turmeric powder, spring onions, salt and water.
Now close it with a lid and let it cook for 15 minutes on medium flame.
Serve hot with chappatis or puris.
tags:
Maharashtrian Bhaji
Indian Tiffin Box, Lunch box, Dabba

times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Bhakarwadi recipe - How to make Bhakarwadi
ingredients:
For The Dough:
 2/3 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 1/2 cups plain flour (maida)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 To Be Mixed Together For The Stuffing:
 1/2 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 1/2 tbsp coriander (dhania) powder
 100 gms roasted poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 200 gms grated coconut
 3 green chillies
 2 tsp chopped ginger (adrak)
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 Other Ingredients:
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Sieve the besan, refined flour, chilli powder, asafoetida and salt together and transfer in a bowl.
Knead into a stiff dough along with 2 tsp oil and using little water. Keep aside.
Divide the stuffing into equal portions and keep aside.
Divide the dough into equal portions as the stuffing and roll out each portion into a small circle for 2" diameter.
Place a portion if the stuffing and roll out like a cylinder.
Make more such vadis using all the stuffing and dough.
Arrange all the flutes in a plate and steam for 20 minutes.
Cool and cut them into 2 cm round discs.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry these vadis till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot or store in an air-tight container.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Maharashtrian Snacks Nashta
Indian Jar Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Chivda recipe - How to make Sabudana Chivda
ingredients:
1 cup nylon sago (sabudana)
 2 tsp peanuts
 salt to taste
 1/4 tsp chaat masala
 1/4 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 tsp freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) powder
 ghee for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Roast the nylon sabudana and keep aside.
Heat the kadhia and put the ghee,when it becomes hot deep fry the sabudana little litte at a time.
After you finish frying all the sago add all the above ingredients.
Serve or keep it in the air tight container,
tags: Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Flax Seeds Chutney recipe - How to make Flax Seeds Chutney
ingredients:
1 cup flaxseeds
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
recipe:
Method
Roast the flax seeds for 5 minutes, then add all the above ingredients and blend into the mixture.
Serve with chapati or jawar roti with oil and curds.
tags: Maharashtrian Chutneys, Maharashtrian Pickles
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 5 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Easy Anarase Recipe recipe - How to make Easy Anarase Recipe
ingredients:
1 cup rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 3/4 cup jaggery (gur)
 1 tbsp poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 1 tsp ghee
 ghee for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Combine the rice flour and jaggery and blend in the mixer by adding little water to make a soft dough.
Keep aside for 4-5 days in the air tight container.
After 4-5 days take out from the container knead well adding little milk if required
Place the poppy seeds in a flat clean surface.
Make lemon sized balls of the dough, take a 1 ball and put some ghee to your fingers and to the ball, then put that lemon sized ball on the some portion of poppy seeds and flatten with your fingers till 1 1/2" size (like a small puri).
Heat the ghee in a kadhai and deep fry till light brown in colour.
Do same with remaining portions.
Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve warm or store in an air-tight container.
tags: Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Farali Potli recipe - How to make Farali Potli
ingredients:
For The Dough:
 1 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 cup waterchestnut (shingoda) flour
 rock saltto taste
 2 tbsp oil
 For The Stuffing:
 4 boiled and mashed potatoes
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 3 chopped green chillies
 1 tsp chilli powder
 rock salt to taste
 2 tsp oil
 10 cashewnuts (kaju)
 10 raisins (kismis)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tsp sliced ginger (adrak)
 Other Ingredients:
 oil for frying
recipe:
For the dough
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, add 1/2 cup of water, mix well and knead into a tight dough.
Cover and keep in the refrigerator for 10 minutes.
For the stuffing
Heat the oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the green chillies and red chilli powder and saute for 1 minute.
Add the potatoes and rock salt, mix well and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the cashewnuts, raisins, garlic and coriander, mix well and remove from the flame.
Keep aside to cool.
How to proceed
Divide the dough into small equal portions and roll each portion into small puris.
Apply little water with your fingers on the corner of puri.
Place 2 spoon of stuffing in middle of puri and bring the sides together to seal and form a potli.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry these potlies on a slow flame till golden brown.
Serve hot with amchoor ki chatni
tags: Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Dill Leaves with Moong Dal recipe - How to make Dill Leaves with Moong Dal
ingredients:
3 cups chopped dill leaves
 3 tbsp boiled yellow moong dal (split yellow gram)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 a few curry leaves (kadi patta)
recipe:
Method
Heat the oil in a non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds , turmeric powder, curry leaves and moong dal and saute for a minutes.
Add dill leaves and cook for 5 to 10 minutes stirring occasionally.
Add salt, chilli powder, coriander and cumin seeds powder and mix and then cook for another two minutes.
Serve hot with chapatis or rotis.
tags:
Maharashtrian Bhaji
Non-stick Pan
Quick Sabzis
Healthy Dry Sabzis
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Farali Cool Dessert recipe - How to make Farali Cool Dessert
ingredients:
1/2 cup sago (sabudana)  (medium size)
 sugar to taste
 1/2 cup saffron (kesar) strands flavoured cold milk , refer handy tip
 1 cup mango pulp
 water as required
recipe:
Method
Wash and soak the sago for 2 hours.
Take a thick bottomed pan and heat 2 to 3 cups water.
When the water starts boiling, add the sago.
Stir occasionally for 5 to 10 minutes.
Then add sugar and cook till the sugar melts.
Keep aside to cool.
Once cooled add the kesar flavoured cold milk and mango pulp.
Serve chilled.
Handy tip :
To make the kesar flavoured milk, add 4 to 5 strands of kesar to hot milk.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
Collection of Kheer
Non-stick Pan
times: Preparation Time: 10  mins, Cooking Time: 10  mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masaledar Khichdi recipe - How to make Masaledar Khichdi
ingredients:
1 cup rice (chawal)
 1 cup yellow moong dal (split yellow gram)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 8 to 10 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 To Be Ground Into Masala:
 1 tsp black peppercorns (kalimirch)
 1 tsp cloves (laung / lavang)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds
 2 tsp dry coconut (kopra)
 1" stick cinnamon (dalchini)
 For The Serving:
recipe:
Method
Roast the moong dal in a pan till the colour changes.
Remove and keep aside to cool.
Wash the rice and moong dal together and soak them in a pressure cooker with 4 cups of water and salt, mix well. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a small kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and dry ground masalas, mix well and saute for 1 minute.
Add to the rice and moong dal mixture, mix well and pressure cook for 3 whistles.
Serve hot with ghee.
tags:
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
One Dish Vegetarian Meals
One Meal Dinner
collection of khichdi recipes
Indian Pressure Cooker
Pressure Cooker

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Pakoda recipe - How to make Sabudana Pakoda
ingredients:
1 cup sago (sabudana)
 1 cup curds (dahi)
 3 to 4 onions, chopped
 2 tsp green chilli paste
 salt to taste
 1/2 cup rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 coriander (dhania) leaves
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Soak sabudana in dhai for 2hrs.
Then add green chill paste,onions,rice flour,salt,and hara dhania and make a paste.
Then take a pan and oil in that,heat it.
Pakode ke tharah deep fry till golden brown,
Serve with green chuteny or tomato sause.
Yummy chrisp sabudana pakodas ready to eat.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
Deep Fry
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 10min, Cooking Time: 10min, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Aamabtvaran recipe - How to make Aamabtvaran
ingredients:
1 cup toovar (arhar) dal
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 1 pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp chopped jaggery (gur)
 4 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds powder
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 2 tsp crushed garlic (lehsun)
 salt to taste
 oil for cooking
recipe:
Method
Pressure cook the dal with asafoeitda and turmeric powder till soft.
Cool and mash the dal.
Add the chilli powder, tamarind pulp and water to make it of  pouring consistency. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a deep pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the asafoetida, bay leaves and crushed garlic and saute till the garlic turns golden brown in colour.
Add the jaggery and salt, mix well and bring it to boil.
Serve hot garnished with coriander and with rice or chapatis.
tags: Maharashtrian Dal, Varan / Amti / Kalvan
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Dry Coconut With Jaggery Modak recipe - How to make Dry Coconut With Jaggery Modak
ingredients:
2 cups whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 For Filling:
 1 cup grated coconut
 3/4 cup grated jaggery (gur)
 1 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 Other Ingredients:
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Combine the wheat flour and enough water and knead into a soft dough.
Cover and keep aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
for the filling
Combine all the ingredients and mix well.
how to proceed
Take the dough and make lemon size balls from it.
Roll them , put the filling and then give modak shape.
Take a pan and put oil, and deep fry the modak till they become golden-brown in colour.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.
tags: Maharashtrian Sweet Dishes
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Shankar Poli recipe - How to make Shankar Poli
ingredients:
1/2 kg plain flour (maida)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp chilli powder
 2  pinches asafoetida (hing)
 water - for mixing
 oil - for deep frying
recipe:
Firstly, sieve maida and take it in a bowl, add salt, chilli powder, asafoetida and mix thoroughly with water and knead them thickly to make dough.
Make balls out of the dough and roll them like thin chappatis.
Meanwhile keep oil in a kadai and heat it in a medium flame.
When the oil is heating, cut the chappathis into small diamond shaped pieces with the help of a knife.
Like this, make pieces of each chappati and keep them in each plate.
Now drop all the pieces of one chappati into the oil and fry them until done.
Likewise do for all the rolls and fill it with air tight container.
Kids will enjoy these crispies all the time walking and running around during these summer holidays.
tags: Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
times: Total Time: 0 mins , Preparation Time: 10 Mts   Cooking Time: 10 - 15 mts

recipe_long_name: Matki Misal recipe - How to make Matki Misal
ingredients:
For The Poha:
 1 cup beaten rice (poha)
 1 tbsp peanuts
 1/8 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 lemon juice to taste
 1 tbsp oil
 For Misal:
 1 cup matki (moath beans) , soaked overnight
 2 medium potatoes , boiled and chopped
 1/2 tsp goda masala
 1/2 tsp garam masala
 1 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 1 tsp crushed garlic (lehsun)
 1 tsp crushed ginger (adrak)
 2 tsp lemon juice
 3 tbsp oil
 To Serve:
 1 cup mixed farsan
 1 cup onions , finely chopped
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 lemon , cut into wedges
 10 slices of bread
recipe:
For the poha
Wash the poha and keep aside for 15 minutes.
Heat the oil in a pan, add peanuts and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add the poha, salt, turmeric and mix well and cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Keep aside.
For misal
Boil the matki in enough water till soft. Drain and keep aside.
Combine the 2 goda masala, garam masala, chilli powder, salt , crushed garlic and ginger and blend in a mixer along with 1 cup water till smooth. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a large and deep pan, add ginger garlic paste and saute for 1 minute.
Add masala paste and mix well and add the potatoes and saute for 5 minutes.
Add the boiled drained matki along with 3 cups water and bring to boil.
Simmer on a slow flame for 10- 15 minutes or till oil forms layer on top.
Add salt, lemon juice, mix well and keep aside.
For serving
Place a tbsp of poha in serving bowls and spread a tbsp of farsan over it.
Pour a ladle full of misal and garnish with onions,  coriander, and a piece of lemon.
Serve hot with slices of plain bread.
tags:
Maharashtrian Bhaji
Maharashtrian Dal, Varan / Amti / Kalvan
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 45 mins, Total Time: 1 hours 15 minutes,

recipe_long_name: Baingan Bhaat recipe - How to make Baingan Bhaat
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups horizontally sliced brinjals (baingan / eggplant)
 1 cup long grained rice (basmati)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 3 cardamoms (elaichi)
 1/2  " piece of cinnamon (dalchini)
 5 cloves (laung / lavang)
 1/2 tsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 2 green chillies, slit
 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 To be ground into a spice powder:
 2 cloves (laung / lavang), roasted
 1/2  " piece of cinnamon (dalchini)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds, roasted
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera), roasted
 1 tsp caraway seeds (shahjeera)
 2 tbsp sesame seeds (til)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Wash and soak the rice for about 10 minutes. drain and keep aside.
Combine all the ingredients including the spice powder in a pressure cooker.
Add 2½ cups of warm water and pressure cook for 2 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening. separate each grain of rice lightly with fork.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 15, Cooking Time: 15, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masala Bhat  By shshy recipe - How to make Masala Bhat  By shshy
ingredients:
2  boiled potatoes
 1/4 onion , cut into slits
 1  medium tomato , chopped
 1 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 2 tsp olive oil
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing) and turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp garam masala
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1  small green chilli , chopped  into small pieces
 1  small strand of curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) leaves
 1 tsp ghee
 1 1/2  glass of rice (chawal)
recipe:
Microwave the rice or pressure cooker it. 
Meanwhile, mash the potatoes into slightly medium chunks.
In a kadai, heat olive oil.
Add jeera. after it becomes hot, add the cut curry leaves. 
Add ginger-garlic paste. add onions.
Add hing, haldi, chili powder & garam masala. 
After a minute, add the cut tomatoes & green chilies.
Add salt & mix well. now add the boiled mashed potatoes.
Stir for 2 minutes. switch off the gas.
After the rice is done, add it to the kadai. mix well. 
Add a 1 tsp of ghee & coriander leaves.
Keep it closed.
Mix & serve while ready to eat.

times: Preparation Time: 4 min, Total Time: 4 mins ,     Cooking Time: 20 min (including rice cooking)

recipe_long_name: Rajgira Thalipith  By guptagauri recipe - How to make Rajgira Thalipith  By guptagauri
ingredients:
2  boiled potatoes, (smashed - don't make paste.)
 1 cup rajgira flour
 1/2 tsp dried mango powder (amchur)
 1 tsp lemon juice
 1/2 tsp crushed ginger (adrak)
 1/2 tsp green chilli paste
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 1/4 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
recipe:
Mix all ingredience and make dough with some water. now make small balls out 
Of the dough. put one dough ball on plastic and spread it till its in roti 
Shape. put some ghee(clarified butter) on pan. now on slow gas, shalow fry 
Them like paratha. serve with chilled yogart (you can mix cocumbur in curd 
And serve with th is)
